chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (1st) and Operating w/ PAC >=0.08, <0.15 (1st). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (1st) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC >=0.08, <0.15 (1st) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mary L Mendoza was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Mary L Mendoza was found guilty of OWI (1st). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court
Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
$200.00 cash bond applied. 
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold except for employment purposes at Quillens and Rice Lake Family Restaurant.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. Must participate in a Victim Impact Panel and Victim Offender Conferencing through Barron County Restorative Justice.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 5 days credit if revoked.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.   Attorney Fees To Be Determined.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  Enclosed is an assessment information sheet.  Also enclosed is an assessment referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the assessment information sheet.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mary L Mendoza in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
PSI discussed.
No corrections by State.
Attorney Yonko relates regarding two corrections to PSI.
Argument by State.
Argument by Defense.  Agreed 5 days jail credit.
Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders:
Count 1:
SW - 2 years probation.
5 days jail credit, if revoked.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold or served except Quillens and Rice Lake Family Restaraunt for employment.  
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
DNA sample and surcharge.  Defendant must submit to DNA sample on Tuesday, 01/05/2016 or Thursday, 01/07/2016, between 1 - 5 pm.
Court costs.
Defendant must participate in a Victim Impact Panel and Victim Offender Conferencing through Barron County Restorative Justice.


Count 2
.114
$824.50
AODA
7 months revocation

Felony admonitions given along with voter's rights form.
Order to Submit DNA Specimen form given to defendant.

Defendant Mary L Mendoza in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State relates agreement. 
Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 and count 2. Court accepts the pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. 
State moves to dismiss and read-in remaining counts. Court orders remaining counts be dismissed and read-in. 

PSI ordered. Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold. 
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  
Must have no contact with Dennis or Brian F.

THIS BOND IS ALSO MODIFIED AS FOLLOWS: DEFENDANT MAY NOT GO ONTO ANY PREMISES WHERE ALCOHOL IS SOLD EXCEPT FOR LITTLE BEAR RESORT DURING HER WORKING HOURS. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

8-21-2015   
BOND IS MODIFIED TO REMOVE THE DAILY PBT CONDITION AND ADD 
MUST NOT OPERATE A MOTOR VEHICLE WHATSOEVER.
ALL OTHER CONDITIONS TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Mary L Mendoza in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko by telephone.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Yonko requests bond be modified to remove daily PBT condition.  State relates.  Court modifies bond to remove daily PBT condition and modifies condition to must not operate a motor vehicle whatsoever - All other conditions remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Mary L Mendoza in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko (Atty. Yonko appears telephonically).  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Yonko relates.  This hearing is on defense' motion to modify bond to remove PBT condition.
State objects to bond modification.
Court relates.  
Court denies motion to modify bond at this time.
7/20/15 Letter to Judge Boyle from Attorney Yonko with request for bond modification.

Defendant Mary L Mendoza in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court orders Defendant to be fingerprinted before leaving the Justice Center today. Not guilty plea entered. Defense requests bond modification - State objects - Attorney Yonko relates - Court denies bond modification and indicates needs medical documentation and can be scheduled for a bond modification hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

15CF265: Defendant Devontee T Works in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Defendant Devontee T Works in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF264: Defendant Mary L Mendoza in court with attorney Richard Yonko. Defendant Mary L Mendoza in custody. Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:20: Patrol Sergeant Derrick Hodek with the Barron County Sheriff's Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies both Defendants. 9:29: Cross by Attorney Sutton. 9:30: Cross by Attorney Yonko. 9:31: Court questions witness. State makes argument. Court finds probable cause on both cases and binds over for trial.

Both cases set for arraignment on 7/15/15 at 10:00 a.m.

15CF264: Defense makes bond modification request. State makes objection. Court reduces bond to $200.00 cash with added condition that she must submit to daily PBT's at the Rice Lake Police Department at 6:00 a.m. Must not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold except for Little Bear Resort during her working hours. All other conditions remain in full force and effect. 

15CF265: Defense makes bond modification request. Court orders that the $500.00 cash bond be returned to Defendant (already posted) but $500.00 cash bond remains in effect.  Arraignment scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
